definition: Fahai, name of the evil Buddhist monk in Tale of the White Snake 白蛇傳
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
variant of 法[fa3]
old variant of 法[fa3]/law
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
surname Hai

sentences.english: Is Fahai in "The Legend of the White Snake" good or bad?
sentences.chinese: 戏说《新白娘子传奇》中的法海，到底是好还是坏？

sentences.english: Fahai Temple murals with the twists and turns of history, preserved only several ordeal.
sentences.chinese: 法海寺壁画有着曲折的历史，几经磨难才保存至今。

sentences.english: Compared with Fahai, I hate him more.
sentences.chinese: 相比于法海，我更讨厌他。

sentences.english: Master Fahai thought that their marriage had violated traditional marriage and corrupted public morals.
sentences.chinese: 禅师法海认为他们的结合违反传统婚姻，伤风败俗。

sentences.english: To a certain extent, Fahai Temple on the murals represent the highest achievements of the Ming Dynasty frescoes.
sentences.chinese: 在一定程度上法海寺壁画代表了明代壁画最高的成就。

sentences.english: Fahaisi is one smoke away from here.
sentences.chinese: 法海寺离这儿只有一袋烟的工夫。

definition: (name of a person) Bai Suzhen, from Madame White Snake

(Buddhism) to deliver all living creatures from suffering (idiom)
Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)
senior monk
